alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 6:16PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF WIND RIVER BASIN...UPPER WIND RIVER BASIN...AND ABSAROKA MOUNTAINS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 615 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was 12 miles north of Crowheart, or 19 miles east of Dubois moving east at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED... This band of heavy snow will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wind River Basin, east central Upper Wind River Basin and south central Absaroka Mountains Counties. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin
